					specified for this element if it belongs to a different namespace.

desc.name: coreopt
desc.comment:
This is the list of the core attributes that all elements in the content
					part of the document must have. In elements using this attribute definition both
					the refersTo attribute and the eId attribute are optional

desc.name: corereq
desc.comment:
This is the list of the core attributes that all elements in the content
					part of the document must have. In elements using this attribute definition the
					refersTo attribute is optional but the eId attribute is required

desc.name: corereqreq
desc.comment:
This is the list of the core attributes that all elements in the content
					part of the document must have. In elements using this attribute definition both
					the refersTo attribute and the eId attribute are required

desc.name: date
desc.comment:
The attribute date is used to give a normalized value for a date according
					to the XSD syntax YYYY-MM-DD or a normalized value for a dateTime according to
					the XSD syntax YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss(zzzz)

desc.name: dictionary
desc.comment:
This attribute specifies the eId of the element in the references section
					detailing the dictionary used for the keyword.

desc.name: enactment
desc.comment:
These attributes are those already defined in attribute list "period",
					plus the attribute status, that allows to specify the status of the piece of
					text it wraps.

desc.name: fillInWidth
desc.comment:
the attribute width of the element fillIn specifies the width of the
					fillIn element.

desc.name: for
desc.comment:
The attribute for is used in modification elements to specify the element
					this is a modification of.

desc.name: fromLanguage
desc.comment:
This attribute specifies the human language of the expression this is a
					translation of. Values are taken from the RFC 4646.

desc.name: frozen
desc.comment:
The attribute frozen for the condition element specifies whether the
					condition is frozen or not in the time period of this expression.

desc.name: duration
desc.comment:
The duration attribute is used to specify a duration when either the start
					or the end event of a time interval is not known.

desc.name: notes
desc.comment:
These attributes are used by notes, both authorial and editorial. The
					marker is the string to be used as a marker of the note, the placement is the
					position where the note should be placed, and placementBase is the eId of the
					element respect to which the note should be placed near.

desc.name: idopt
desc.comment:
These attributes identify the element in an absolute manner. In elements
					using this attribute definition the eId attribute is optional. The wId is used
					to mark the identifier that the structure used to have in the original version,
					and is only needed when a renumbering occurred.

desc.name: idreq
desc.comment:
These attributes identify the element in an absolute manner. In elements
					using this attribute definition the eId attribute is required whenever the Akoma
					Ntoso naming Convention is used. The wId is used to mark the identifier that the
					structure used to have in the original version, and is only needed when a
					renumbering occurred.

desc.name: imgAtts
desc.comment: these attributes specify the dimension of the image.

desc.name: interval
desc.comment:
The start and end attributes are used to specify events that mark the
					beginning and the end of a time interval. Both are references to eventRef
					elements in the lifecycle element

desc.name: language
desc.comment:
This attribute specifies the human language in which the document the
					element refers to is expressed. Values are taken from the RFC 4646.

desc.name: lawyerAtts
desc.comment:
The attributes in lawyerAtts are used in the inline element lawyer to
					identify representation aspects of lawyers. In particular, attribute 'as'
					identifies his/her role, attribute 'for' identifies which party it represents,
					and attribute 'empoweredBy' identifies another lawyer, if any, this lawyer
					received the power delegation of power.

desc.name: level
desc.comment: the attribute level specifies the level of the toc element.

desc.name: link
desc.comment:
The attribute href is used to specify an internal or external destination
					for a reference, a citation, an access to the ontology or a hypertext link. In
					elements using this attribute definition the href attribute is
					required

desc.name: linkopt
desc.comment:
The attribute href is used to specify an internal or external destination
					for a reference, a citation, an access to the ontology or a hypertext link. In
					elements using this attribute definition the href attribute is
					optional

desc.name: mappingAtts
desc.comment:
The mappingAtts attributes represent the reference to the permanent wId
					(attribute original) of a structure, and to the eId (attribute current) such
					structure had during the time interval included between an initial temporalGroup
					(attribute start) and a final temporalGroup (attribute end).

desc.name: modifiers
desc.comment:
These attributes are used in the analysis to allow manifestation editors
					to specify whether the analysis is complete and/or ignored in the text

desc.name: name
desc.comment:
The attribute name is used to give a name to all generic
					elements

desc.name: normalizedAtt
desc.comment:
The attribute normalized is used in the inline element quantity to provide
					a normalized value of the number, if appropriate.

desc.name: number
desc.comment:
The attribute number is used to specify a number in the publication of the
					document

desc.name: optvalue
desc.comment:
The attribute value is used to specify a value for metadata elements. In
					elements using this attribute definition the value attribute is
					optional

desc.name: originalText
desc.comment:
the attribute originalText contains the original text of a
					placeholder

desc.name: originating
desc.comment:
The attribute originating is used to identify whether the event is the one
					originating this expression

desc.name: outcome
desc.comment:
The attribute outcome is used to identify the outcome of a step in a
					workflow. It is a reference to a TLCConcept element in the references
					section

desc.name: period
desc.comment:
The period attribute is used in versioned content and metadata elements to
					indicate a time interval in which they were in force, in efficacy, or in any
					other type of interval as specified in the corresponding
					temporalGroup.

desc.name: pivot
desc.comment:
This attribute specifies the human language used as a pivot in the
					translation. Values are taken from the RFC 4646.

desc.name: portionAtt
desc.comment:
the attribute includedIn specifies the eId of the element of the
					references section identifying the document that this portion is a portion
					of.

desc.name: pos
desc.comment:
The attribute pos is used to identify the specific position of the
					reference (e.g., in source or destination) with respect to the element being
					identified with the relative eId.

desc.name: quote
desc.comment:
The attributes startQuote and endQuote are used in quotedText,
					quotedStructure, embeddedText and embeddedStructure to specify the start and
					quote character delimiting the quoted or embedded part. If the characters are
					the same, one can use only startQuote. Attribute inlineQuote is used for marking
					the character showing continuation of a quote e.g. at the beginning of each page
					or at the beginning of each line of the quote

desc.name: range
desc.comment:
These attributes are used in range-based elements to specify the eId of
					the beginning and ending element of the range.

desc.name: refers
desc.comment:
This attribute creates a connection between the element and an element of
					the Akoma Ntoso ontology to which it refers. In elements using this attribute
					definition the refersTo attribute is optional

desc.name: refersreq
desc.comment:
This attribute creates a connection between the element and an element of
					the Akoma Ntoso ontology to which it refers. In elements using this attribute
					definition the refersTo attribute is required

desc.name: role
desc.comment:
The attribute role is used to identify the role of an individual mentioned
					in the text. It is a reference to a TLCRole element in the references
					section

desc.name: show
desc.comment:
These attributes are used in metadata to propose visible representations
					of the metadata itself. Both a full visualization (attribute showAs) and an
					abbreviated one (attribute shortForm) can be specified

desc.name: source
desc.comment:
The attribute source links to the agent (person, organization) providing
					the specific annotation or markup

desc.name: speechAtts
desc.comment:
The attributes in speechAtts are used in speeches to identify agents and
					roles of speeches. In particular, attribute 'by' identifies the speaker,
					optional attribute 'as' identifies the role under which the speaker is speaking,
					optional attribute startTime specifies the absolute date and time where the
					individual speech item started, optional attribute endTime specifies the
					absolute date and time where the individual speech item ended, and optional
					attribute to identifies the addressee of the speech. All of them are references
					to person or organization elements in the references section

desc.name: src
desc.comment:
These attributes are used in manifestation-level references to specify
					external manifestation-level resources to be loaded in place. The src attribute
					holds the manifestation-level IRI of the resource, while the alt attribute holds
					the text to be displayed in case the loading of the external resource is not
					possible for any reason.

desc.name: tableAtts
desc.comment: these attributes specify the characteristics of the table.

desc.name: target
desc.comment: the attribute target specifies the target of the a element.

desc.name: time
desc.comment:
The attribute time is used to give a normalized value for a time according
					to the XSD syntax HH:MM:SS

desc.name: type
desc.comment:
The type attribute is used in various element to identify a type without
					restrictions as to its values.

desc.name: upTo
desc.comment:
The attribute upTo is used in range-based elements to specify the eId of
					the ending element of the range.

desc.name: value
desc.comment:
The attribute value is used to specify a value for metadata elements. In
					elements using this attribute definition the value attribute is
					required

desc.name: voteAtts
desc.comment:
The attributes in voteAtts are used in votes to identify agents and
					choices in votes. In particular, attribute 'by' identifies the voter, optional
					attribute 'as' identifies the role under which the voter is acting, optional
					attribute 'choice' specifies the vote that was casted.

desc.name: xmllang
desc.comment:
These attribute specify the human language in which the content of the
					element is expressed as well as the rules for whitespace management in the
					element. Values for xml:lang are taken from the RFC 4646. Both xml:lang and
					xml:space are reserved attributes of the XML language, and cannot be used for
					any other purpose than these ones.
